MeasurementToolMetadata.Description: MDS-Unified Parkinsons Disease Rating Scale: Part 1 (MDS-UPDRS: Part 1)

updrs1_01.Description: Over the past week have you had problems remembering things, following conversations, paying attention, thinking clearly, or finding your way around the house or in town?

Levels.1: Slight: Impairment appreciated by patient or caregiver with no concrete interference with the patient?s ability to carry out normal activities and social interactions
Levels.2: Mild: Clinically evident cognitive dysfunction, but only minimal interference with the patient?s ability to carry out normal activities and social interaction
Levels.3: Moderate: Cognitive deficits interfere with but do not preclude the patient?s ability to carry out normal activities and social interactions
Levels.4: Severe: Cognitive dysfunction precludes the patient?s ability to carry out normal activities and social interactions

updrs1_02.Description: Over the past week have you seen, heard, smelled, or felt things that were not really there?

Levels.0: Normal: No hallucinations or psychotic behavior
Levels.1: Slight: Illusions or non-formed hallucinations, but patient recognizes them without loss of insight
Levels.2: Mild: Formed hallucinations independent of environmental stimuli. No loss of insight
Levels.3: Moderate: Formed hallucinations with loss of insight
Levels.4: Severe: Patient has delusions or paranoia

updrs1_03.Description: Over the past week have you felt low, sad, hopeless, or unable to enjoy things? If yes, was this feeling for longer than one day at a time? Did it make it difficult for you carry out your usual activities or to be with people?

Levels.1: Slight: Episodes of depressed mood that are not sustained for more than one day at a time. No interference with patient?s ability to carry out normal activities and social interactions
Levels.2: Mild: Depressed mood that is sustained over days, but without interference with normal activities and social interactions
Levels.3: Moderate: Depressed mood that interferes with, but does not preclude the patient?s ability to carry out normal activities and social interactions
Levels.4: Severe: Depressed mood precludes patient?s ability to carry out normal activities and social interactions

updrs1_04.Description: Over the past week have you felt nervous, worried, or tense? If yes, was this feeling for longer than one day at a time? Did it make it difficult for you to follow your usual activities or to be with other people?

Levels.1: Slight: Anxious feelings present but not sustained for more than one day at a time. No interference with patient?s ability to carry out normal activities and social interactions
Levels.2: Mild: Anxious feelings are sustained over more than one day at a time, but without interference with patient?s ability to carry out normal activities and social interactions
Levels.3: Moderate: Anxious feelings interfere with, but do not preclude, the patient?s ability to carry out normal activities and social interactions
Levels.4: Severe: Anxious feelings preclude patient?s ability to carry out normal activities and social interactions

updrs1_05.Description: Over the past week, have you felt indifferent to doing activities or being with people?

Levels.1: Slight: Apathy appreciated by patient and/or caregiver, but no interference with daily activities and social interactions
Levels.2: Mild: Apathy interferes with isolated activities and social interactions
Levels.3: Moderate: Apathy interferes with most activities and social interactions
Levels.4: Severe: Passive and withdrawn, complete loss of initiative

updrs1_06.LongName: UPDRS 1.6: Features of Dopamine Dysregulation Syndrome
updrs1_06.Description: Over the past week, have you had unusually strong urges that are hard to control? Do you feel driven to do or think about something and find it hard to stop?

Levels.1: Slight: Problems are present but usually do not cause any difficulties for the patient or family/caregiver
Levels.2: Mild: Problems are present and usually cause a few difficulties in the patient?s personal and family life
Levels.3: Moderate: Problems are present and usually cause a lot of difficulties in the patient?s personal and family life
Levels.4: Severe: Problems are present and preclude the patient?s ability to carry out normal activities or social interactions or to maintain previous standards in personal and family life

updrs1_07.Description: Over the past week, have you had trouble going to sleep at night or staying asleep through the night?

Levels.1: Slight: Sleep problems are present but usually do not cause trouble getting a full night of sleep
Levels.2: Mild: Sleep problems usually cause some difficulties getting a full night of sleep
Levels.3: Moderate: Sleep problems cause a lot of difficulties getting a full night of sleep, but I still usually sleep for more than half the night
Levels.4: Severe: I usually do not sleep for most of the night

updrs1_08.Description: Over the past week, have you had trouble staying awake during the daytime?

Levels.1: Slight: Daytime sleepiness occurs, but I can resist and I stay awake
Levels.2: Mild: Sometimes I fall asleep when alone and relaxing. For example, while reading or watching TV
Levels.3: Moderate: I sometimes fall asleep when I should not. For example, while eating or talking with other people
Levels.4: Severe: I often fall asleep when I should not. For example, while eating or talking with other people

updrs1_09.Description: Over the past week, have you had uncomfortable feelings in your body like pain, aches, tingling, or cramps?

Levels.1: Slight: I have these feelings. However, I can do things and be with other people without difficulty
Levels.2: Mild: These feelings cause some problems when I do things or am with other people
Levels.3: Moderate: These feelings cause a lot of problems, but they do not stop me from doing things or being with other people
Levels.4: Severe: These feelings stop me from doing things or being with other people

updrs1_10.Description: Over the past week, have you had trouble with urine control? For example, an urgent need to urinate, a need to urinate too often, or urine accidents?

Levels.1: Slight: I need to urinate often or urgently. However, these problems do not cause difficulties with my daily activities
Levels.2: Mild: Urine problems cause some difficulties with my daily activities. However, I do not have urine accidents
Levels.3: Moderate: Urine problems cause a lot of difficulties with my daily activities, including urine accidents
Levels.4: Severe: I cannot control my urine and use a protective garment or have a bladder tube

updrs1_11.Description: Over the past week have you had constipation troubles that cause you difficulty moving your bowels?

Levels.1: Slight: I have been constipated. I use extra effort to move my bowels. However, this problem does not disturb my activities or my being comfortable
Levels.2: Mild: Constipation causes me to have some troubles doing things or being comfortable
Levels.3: Moderate: Constipation causes me to have a lot of trouble doing things or being comfortable. However, it does not stop me from doing anything
Levels.4: Severe: I usually need physical help from someone else to empty my bowels

updrs1_12.Description: Over the past week, have you felt faint, dizzy, or foggy when you stand up after sitting or lying down?

Levels.0: Normal: No dizzy or foggy feelings
Levels.1: Slight: Dizzy or foggy feelings occur. However, they do not cause me troubles doing things
Levels.2: Mild: Dizzy or foggy feelings cause me to hold on to something, but I do not need to sit or lie back down
Levels.3: Moderate: Dizzy or foggy feelings cause me to sit or lie down to avoid fainting or falling
Levels.4: Severe: Dizzy or foggy feelings cause me to fall or faint

updrs1_13.Description: Over the past week, have you usually felt fatigued?

Levels.1: Slight: Fatigue occurs. However it does not cause me troubles doing things or being with people
Levels.2: Mild: Fatigue causes me some troubles doing things or being with people
Levels.3: Moderate: Fatigue causes me a lot of troubles doing things or being with people. However, it does not stop me from doing anything
Levels.4: Severe: Fatigue stops me from doing things or being with people
